body_html:
@gaohuazuo this is by (suboptimal) design.

get_session_tensor requires a TensorHandle object in order to figure to pass some extra information (device assignment).

This object is obtained when you issue session.run on get_session_tensor op. It comes from special logic in client/session.py which is only triggered for get_session_handle ops. In your failing case, you are evaluating a different op (identity), which gives you a regular numpy array rather than TensorHandle

See #6131

body:
@gaohuazuo this is by (suboptimal) design.

get_session_tensor requires a TensorHandle object in order to figure to pass some extra information (device assignment).

This object is obtained when you issue session.run on get_session_tensor op. It comes from special logic in client/session.py which is only triggered for get_session_handle ops. In your failing case, you are evaluating a different op (identity), which gives you a regular numpy array rather than TensorHandle

See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/6131
